latest_revision.text:
=What is it? Like the store?=
Hot Topics is our unfortunately named lightning talks series modeled on events like Ignite, Ted, and [http://www.noisebridge.net/wiki/Five_Minutes_of_Fame Noisebridge's Five Minutes of Fame]. Talks are <5 minutes and generally revolved around creation and hackerspace culture.

=When?=
Hot Topics is generally scheduled to coincide with Mesa's monthly Second Friday event starting between 7 and 8pm, however check the [http://www.heatsynclabs.org/events/ Event Calendar] for confirmation.

=Why?=
It is an opportunity to :
*keep up to date with each other's projects
*connect with other hackerspaces 
*explain to the world at large what 'hackers' get up to

=How do I participate?=
Send an email to info@heatsynclabs.org with your presentation topic and title and we'll notify the speakers prior to the event.  If your talk wasn't accepted this month, submit again!

=Past Presentations=
==9/15==
*[http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IuexRmzvi6g Will Bradley, LED Matrix, laser engraving and fabrics project]
*[http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eB0imlt_51o Jasper Nance, SEM Project update]
*[http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1RMV0yxxMh8 Harry Meier, Transcranial DC stimulation]
*[http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9NRjHgD7WRA Prescott Ogden, Introduction to Bitcoin]
*[http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xRFm-LCqL1w Killhamster, Introduction to Buttcoin]
*[http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OBh5y_NMHjQ Isaac Olson, Local Motors' Open Source Car]
*[http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QOcn3ORc9dw Clark Jones, Digital Altimeters]
